content.description: Undercling the Roof going left to the baffling crux move to a jug(Don't fall), then continue up right then head straight up to the last bolt of Perro De La Gurra to cold shut anchor.
content.protection: Bolts protect all, Ledge fall possible between 3rd and 4th bolt.
content.location: Left of Perro same start but go hard left.

content.description: The route farthest to the right on the main wall. Crux is a big move up and left after the second bolt. For shorter people this is way harder.
content.location:
Farthest route on the right up the hill on the main wall. Rap off.

Shares the first bolt with Perro Del Amore 5.12a which goes left after the first bolt.

content.description: The crux is getting past the first bolt, doing an improbable move that is height dependent.
content.protection: Bolts. Hidden 3 bolt right side of Arete' long sling needed or skip it.
content.location: To the right of the Pyramid on the steep mini headwall with 2 bolts that are very close together.

content.description: Start on the right prow/arete, continue up to a nice lieback crack, then head up and right to anchors.
content.location: Obvious pyramid shaped face on the right side of the main wall.

content.description: Thin crimpy slab moves while side pulling the arete. The crux comes after clipping the 4th bolt aboveÂ the steep overlaps
content.protection:
4 bolts to 2 closed shuts

30m rope is suffice for this route
content.location: Far right up the hill on the main face. Sharing the first bolt of Turning Point then moves left to a steep slab. Rap off.

content.description: An excellent route that demands superior footwork and the ability to hold onto some small holds. Begin on "Flying Guillotine" and after clipping the 1st two bolts climb left following the corner. Clip the next 2 bolts of "Flying Guillotine" from the corner and then continue up and left passing 3 more bolts.

go up the steep face left of the dihedral clipping the first 3 bolts, then traverse right around the arete and follow a jagged crack to the anchor chain links. can place gear in the crack or simply clip the line of bolts within arm's reach on the face right of the crack. clipping 2 or 3 out of these 4 bolts would make a total of 5 or 6 bolts to clip
content.location: To the right of Holy Crap

content.description: Flying Guillotine shares the same start as Holy Crap. After pulling the overhang move right continuing right traversing the undercling them up the finger jam crack to the anchor.
content.location: Starts on the far left of the main wall. Just left of Perro De La Guerro. Rap off. This route is the third route from the left on the main wall but starts far left.

content.description: go up the center face up to the thin crack under the roof and up.
content.protection: Bolts, Anchor Chains at top of route
content.location: To the right of Holy Crap

content.description:
A fun, plumb bob of a route which ascends a neat line up improbable steepness.

Climb lower angle blocky and kind of tricky slab and shallow cracks to first bolt below roof with crack splitting face above. Climb up through roof, staying to the right of the prow to left. Step left where convenient (joining Flying Guillotine), and, traverse up the bolt protected face on reachy, spaced out jugs on the steep wall.

Climb up through shallow roof (easier than it looks!) and either step left to finish on the open cold shut anchor (top of Perro De La Guerra), or, sling that anchor long and step right to the low angle layback/undercling and follow that to a shallow alcove corner crack.

Clip the last bolt then step up and hit the semi flared finger crack to the chains.

Variations that might be useful: clip first bolt, then step up right and clip the next two bolts on the adjacent route to the right, Circus Midget. Then, step back left and finish as per the above.

Holy Crap is a short variation of Flying Guillotine by going Rt to the 12c anchor thus avoiding the crux of Flying G. Making it about 5.9.
content.protection: 8 bolts to two bolt/chain anchor.  Medium cams would protect the lower angle traverse to the right.
content.location: Located just left of the geographical center bottom of the crag.  Rappel route.

content.description: The crux on this route is getting to the second bolt. Big jug for clipping. Careful of the loose rocks about half way up. You don't need them!
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains. Rap off.
content.location: To the right of the Original Route. Start climbing off the large block about half way up the hill to the right. Lie back starting hold and easy climbing left of the dihedral straight up and around the overhang on the left to meet up with Original Route and use the same anchors on right.
